There is one simplification that I've been considering. In the current patch, when the log cleaner runs, it immediately removes the records from aborted transactions, but leaves the aborted markers around for some time. Additionally, the cleaner copies the retained entries from the old transaction index into the new one. However, with only the abort markers left in the segment, there is no real need to preserve the index entries. Consumers will simply discard the markers when they encounter them. Any reasons this wouldn't work?
@guozhangwang sounds good.

Closing this PR. Thread leak was fixed under #3014. JAAS config logging isn't necessary since none of the issues found were related to JAAS config being incorrect. Instead of thread dump on failure, PR #3026 fails if broker controller has not been shutdown. This is better since thread dump at the time of failure will not provide any indication about which tests may have caused the thread leak.
